subject: RE: [junit] How to test private member variables?
msgSnippet: ... Wow. Mike would kill me if he found out that someone *else* recommended his work before I did. :) J. B. Rainsberger, President, Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
>So said bernd on 2003-07-24 --------------------
>> Now what do you want to test?
>>
>> 1. That main() parses the command line arguments correctly?
>....
>> 2. That main() passes the parameters correctly to MyClass'
>> constructor?
>>
>> Rather than expose getX() methods, add equals() that compares
>> two MyClass objects and answers true if their fields have the
>
>and don't forget to test equals() with gsbase' EqualsTester
>http://gsbase.sourceforge.net/
>http://gsbase.sourceforge.net/apidocs/com/gargoylesoftware/base/testing/Equa
>lsTester.html

Wow. Mike would kill me if he found out that someone *else* recommended his work before I did. :)


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
